title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Orlando Magic 123-110, despite Jaylen Brown's 32-point performance on 15-for-28 shooting.
The Magic made 17 of 36 three-point attempts, outscoring the Celtics from beyond the arc and securing the win.
Payton Pritchard regained his shooting form, scoring 27 points on 5-for-8 three-point shooting against the Magic.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating appearance of impropriety in 2018 ICE incident.
Hearing officer found insufficient evidence that Joseph authorized defendant's evasion from Newton District Courthouse.
Federal charges against Joseph dropped in 2022; reprimand ensures clarity on her alleged misconduct.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite early playoff exit against the Yankees.
Key roster decisions loom as Trevor Story stays, Alex Bregman opts out, and crowded outfield may prompt trades.
Alex Cora reflects on season's challenges and progress, optimistic about potential improvement next year with young talent.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade detached and fell into a cranberry bog in Plymouth, Massachusetts, without causing injuries.
The 75 to 100-foot blade fell near 810 Head of the Bay Road; the turbine automatically shut down in fail-safe mode.
Authorities and maintenance crews secured the area and removed the blade; an investigation into the incident is ongoing.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is now available for streaming on Disney+.
'Frankenstein' by Guillermo del Toro is streaming on Netflix, featuring Jacob Elordi and Oscar Isaac.
'Death by Lightning,' a Netflix limited series, explores President James A. Garfield's story with Michael Shannon in the lead role.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims to improve his attitude, citing a tendency to get mad and a desire for perfection.
Diggs leads the Patriots in multiple categories, including receiving yards (508) and yards per game (56.4) this season.
Diggs credits offensive coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing for creating a balanced, encouraging environment for player growth.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A commuter train in Acton struck an empty car at the Central Street crossing Thursday night; no injuries reported.
The car's driver bypassed crossing gates before exiting the vehicle; a citation will be issued, Transit Police said.
The collision caused delays on the Fitchburg line; Train 1427 was terminated at South Acton due to the incident.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Munetaka Murakami, known as the 'Japanese Babe Ruth,' has been posted by Tokyo Yakult Swallows for MLB free agency.
At 25, Murakami has a Dec. 22 deadline to sign with an MLB team and is linked with the Red Sox among others.
Murakami is a powerful hitter with a history of high strikeout rates, raising concerns about MLB performance.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines waive fees and offer refunds as FAA reduces flights by 10% at 40 airports due to government shutdown.
JetBlue, Southwest, United, American, Delta, and Spirit provide rebooking options and refunds for affected travelers.
Massport advises travelers to check with airlines for delays and cancellations at Logan Airport following flight reductions.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Lynne Forester, 69, was seriously injured in an e-bike crash on Cape Cod, sparking calls for stricter regulations.
A Boston.com reader survey showed 78% support stricter e-bike regulations in Massachusetts, citing safety concerns.
Current Massachusetts law does not regulate Class 3 e-bikes, which can exceed speeds of 20 mph, unlike Class 1 and 2.
